info.title: Qubic RPC API
info.description: API for querying all qubic related data.

get.summary: Returns a list of issued assets.
Returns an asset issuance by universe index.
Returns a list of asset ownerships.

parameters.name: issuerIdentity
parameters.description: Identity of the issuer (required). Defaults to the zero address (smart contract shares).

parameters.name: ownerIdentity
parameters.description: Identity of the owner of the asset (optional).

parameters.name: ownershipManagingContract
parameters.description: Index of the contract that manages the ownership (optional).

get.summary: Returns an asset ownership by universe index.
Returns a list of assets possessions.

parameters.name: issuerIdentity
parameters.description: Identity of the issuer (required). Defaults to the zero address (smart contract shares).

parameters.name: ownerIdentity
parameters.description: Identity of the owner of the asset (optional).

parameters.name: possessorIdentity
parameters.description: Identity of the possessor of the asset (optional).

parameters.name: ownershipManagingContract
parameters.description: Index of the contract that manages the ownership (optional).

parameters.name: possessionManagingContract
parameters.description: Index of the contract that manages the possession (optional).

get.summary: Returns an asset possession by universe index.
Gets assets issued by the specified identity.
Gets assets that are owned by the specified identity.
Gets assets that are possessed by the specified identity.
Gets the balance of the specified identity.

post.summary: Broadcasts a transaction to the network.

get.summary: Returns a list of IPOs that are active in the current epoch.

post.description:
Get the list(s) of computors for one epoch. These are the computors (IDs signed by the arbitrator) that
are allowed to make quorum decisions. It is possible that this list changes within the epoch in case of
arbitrator intervention.

get.description:
Get the last processed tick and other processing information from the archive.
All data queried from the archive is only fully processed up to this tick.
Before calling the service you should check the last processed tick to be sure to get
valid data and do not request data for future ticks that are not processed yet. You  can use
the epoch and initial tick information in the response to switch to a new interval.

Get the tick intervals that are available in the archive. A new tick interval is typically
created on epoch change or network restart within the epoch. Use this endpoint to skip the
tick numbers that are not part of the intervals. This endpoint is only necessary for users
that need to process all available ticks. For most users it is enough to switch to a new
interval by using the `get last processed tick` endpoint.

200.description: a list of tick intervals that were processed.

post.description: Get the tick data for one tick.
Get a single transaction by its hash.

200.description: the transaction for the requested hash.

post.description:
Get the transactions for one identity sorted by tick number descending. ### Request structure | Name | Type | Necessity | Description | |------------|--------------------|-----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | identity | string | required | 60 characters uppercase identity. | | filters | map | optional | Filters that restrict results to single value.
Allowed fields are: source, destination, amount, inputType | | ranges | map | optional | Filters that restrict results to a value range.
Allowed fields are: amount, tickNumber, inputType, timestamp | | pagination | Pagination | optional | Allows to specify the first record and the number of records to be retrieved. | Without filters and ranges all transactions from and to that identity ordered by tick number descending are returned. Data type for all values is string. ### Filters Filters restrict the results by single values. #### Allowed properties | Name | Type | Format | Description | |-------------|---------|------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------| | source | string | 60 character identity | Only find transactions that were sent from the specified identity. | | destination | string | 60 character identity | Only find transactions that were sent to the specified identity. | | amount | string | Numeric | Only find transactions with the specified amount. | | inputType | string | Numeric | Only find transactions with the specified input type. | #### Examples ``` "source": "IIJHZSNPDRYYXCQBWNGKBSWYYDCARTYPOBXGOXZEVEZMMWYHPBVXZLJARRCB", "destination": "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAFXIB" "amount": "1000000" "inputType": "0" ``` ### Ranges Ranges restrict the results by a range of values. On range per property is supported. #### Allowed properties | Name | Type | Format | Description | |------------|--------|------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------| | amount | string | Numeric | Only find transactions in amount range. | | tickNumber | string | Numeric | Only find transactions in tick range. | | inputType | string | Numeric | Only find transactions in input type range. | | timestamp | string | Numeric (Unix Timestamp in milliseconds) | Only find transactions in time range. | #### Range definition A range with size of 0 or 1 is not allowed. | Name | Type | Necessity | Description | |-----------|--------|-----------|-------------------------------------------| | field | string | required | Name of the field you wish to search for. | | gt | string | optional | Greater than. | | gte | string | optional | Greater than or equal to. | | lt | string | optional | Less than. | | lte | string | optional | Less than or equal to. | Only one lower bound and one upper bound can be specified. #### Examples ``` "amount": { "gt": "1000000" } "tickNumber": { "gte": "25563000", "lte": "28300000" } "inputType": { "gt": "0" } "timestamp": { "lt": "1757376000000" } ``` ### Pagination | Name | Type | Necessity | Description | |--------|--------|-----------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | offset | uint32 | optional | The offset of the first record to return. Defaults to zero (first record). Maximum offset is 10000. | | size | uint32 | optional | Defaults to 10. Maximum size is 1000. Zero value is ignored (uses default). |
Get the transactions that are in included in one tick.

200.description: the transactions for the requested tick number.

get.description: Health check. This is for internal use only and can change any time. Do not rely on this endpoint.

contractIndex.description: The index of the related contract (contract address).

assetName.description: The name of the related asset.

inputType.title: identifies the function to be queried

inputSize.title: the size of the input data (request data)

tickNumber.description: tick number when the list was received by the archive after it was published.

identities.description: list of computor identities (signed by arbitrator).

epoch.description: the epoch number to get the computor lists for.

computorsLists.description: the lists of computors that voted in this epoch.

tickNumber.description: the last processed tick that is available in the archive.

epoch.description: the epoch the last processed tick is in.

intervalInitialTick.description: the initial tick of the current tick interval.

processedTickIntervals.description: a list of tick intervals that were processed.

tickNumber.description: the number of tick the tick data is requested for.

tickData.description: the tick data of the requested tick.

transaction.description: the transaction for the requested hash.

identity.description: The identity to get the transactions for. Incoming and outgoing transactions are queried by default.

filters.description: Filters restrict the results by single values.

ranges.description: Ranges restrict the results by a maximum and minimum value.

validForTick.description: the response is valid for this tick number.

transactions.description: list of transactions that matched the search criteria.

tickNumber.description: the tick number to get the transactions for.

transactions.description: the transactions for the requested tick number.

total.description: the total number of hits available in the archive. Capped at 10000.

from.description: starting offset of the hits that were returned.

QubicQuery_pbHits.description: Provides information about the number of results.
QubicQuery_pbHits.title: Hits

offset.description: The offset specifies the starting point of the returned data. Defaults to zero.

size.description: The size specifies how many results should be returned. Defaults to 10.

QubicQuery_pbPagination.description: The number of maximum results (offset + size) is limited to 10000.
QubicQuery_pbPagination.title: Pagination

epoch.description: the epoch the interval is in.

firstTick.description: the initial processed tick of the interval.

lastTick.description: the last processed tick of the interval.

moneyFlew.description: Money flew is an additional information provided by some nodes with the tx status addon patch.
